content:
I've been thinking about my own consumption habits lately. 

This Boxing Week made it louder!

Every deal we chase. Every cart we fill. Every "MORE" we want, it flows somewhere.

A while ago I came across David Katz's TED Talk:

"The very last thing we need to do is clean the ocean. What we really need to do is turn off the tap."

That line stuck with me. How could I stop my tap?

So I made the commitment Boxing Day to ignore the deals and started the production plan for this piece:

A reflection on what we've turned Boxing Day into, and what it could mean again.

Not a resolution. Just a reflection.

HAPPY NEW YEAR!

______

Inspired by David Katz and Plastic Bank's mission to stop the flow at the source.

Produced with My Claude Code Custom Agents, Nano Banana Pro, Kling AI 2.6 Pro, Veo 3.1 and Suno AI

#ConsciousConsumption #CircularEconomy #SustainableLiving #NewYearReflection #MindfulConsumption #BuyLessLiveMore

content:
I just downloaded a YouTube video with free sound effects and extracted 36 individual samples from it in under 2 minutes, all using Claude Agent Skills!

Claude analyzed the audio for transients, split them into separate files, added fade-outs to prevent clipping, and organized everything.

What used to require:
- Manual download and conversion
- Audio editing software expertise
- Identifying each sound effect using the DAW
- Individual trimming and exporting
- 30-45 minutes of work
Now takes: One natural language instruction + 2 minutes.

The youtube-direct-audio, audio-transient-analyzer, and audio-editing skills in this demo are a few of dozens I've built for my Multimedia Production Suite.
But creating each skill took 2+ hours (research, testing, token optimization, documentation).

So I built a 7-agent system to automate skill creation:
Research â†’ Planning â†’ Building â†’ Validation â†’ QA â†’ Documentation â†’ Packaging

Result: 2+ hours â†’ 15-20 minutes per skill. Consistent 7+/10 quality.
Better: Run multiple instances in parallel. 4-5 skills in 20 minutes vs 8-10 hours.

What Claude can now do with audio:
- Professional editing: trim silence, normalize volume, merge files, add fades, batch process
- Transient detection: identify beats/impacts (<10ms accuracy), sync multi-camera footage
- YouTube extraction: download audio from videos/playlists with metadata
- Video audio management: replace camera audio, fix sync drift, normalize to standards
- Format conversion: standardize sample rates, convert formats, batch process

The Skills Factory automates creating these capabilities. Each skill packages domain expertise (FFmpeg, codecs, audio processing) into something Claude executes via natural language.

This is the same approach I use in workflow automation consulting: identify repetitive-but-expertise-heavy processes, break them into automatable skills, enforce quality, measure impact.

What repetitive-but-expertise-heavy production processes does your team deal with?

If you're dealing with similar bottlenecks or different ones, I'd be interested to hear about them. The skills are examples; the value is in the methodology.

#ContentProduction #WorkflowAutomation #ProductionWorkflow #MediaProduction #AIWorkflow

content:
I wasn't planning to share this story, but after the reactions I've gotten in the past few days, I need some honest feedback.

My Uncle Eddie has been a big influence in my life and is loved by our whole large family. For his 77th birthday, I wanted to surprise him with a custom music video. It was partly to give him something special, and partly to test the Agentic Multimedia Production Suite I've been building over the past few months.

I've been experimenting with animating old family photos and creating personalized songs. This felt like the perfect chance to try out a new agentic workflow.

It worked amazingly well. The suite helped with artistic ideas, music creation, and planning the clips and edits. The best part? The song was prompted by family members. My agents analyzed their stories and engineered the music prompt automatically.

I cleaned up many of the old photos in Photoshop and Topaz Photo AI since the video clips were generated from them. The final edit was done by hand in Final Cut Pro. Everything else was handled by my Agents.

I sent the video to the family at 11:00 AM.Â By 11:05, my phone was blowing up with calls and messages.

The response has been overwhelming. Family members and friends who know him keep reaching out, even from different parts of the world. I'm still getting messages days later.

Honest question: Would you commission something like this for a loved one's milestone birthday?

If yes, what would you expect to pay for a 3-4 minute custom video with personalized song and animated family photos? 

(And if this resonates with you, send me a message. I'm considering a small pilot program in January.)

Check the comments for the original photos.

#VideoProduction #AIWorkflow #CustomVideo #ContentAutomation #PersonalizedGift

content:
This is a photo of my dad in the 1950s.

Seeing this iconic picture come to life feels incredibly special. He was a pilot, and this photo always sat on our family shelf; cropped, frozen in time.

For two years, I built web apps to solve my own content production problems. Recently, I realized I was approaching it wrong.

With the power of Claude Code and its agent capabilities, I stopped building tools and started building something different: production workflows powered by specialized agents that work through conversation.

This demo shows what happened when I asked it to bring my dad's photo to life:

â€¢ Parsed my casual request into professional production prompts optimized for each model
â€¢ Presented a detailed creative brief for review before execution
â€¢ Expanded the cropped photo to reveal the full aircraft
â€¢ Generated a cinematic reveal video with frame-to-frame morphing
â€¢ Added period-appropriate propeller sounds
â€¢ 15 minutes total, just talking through what I wanted

With my Multimedia-Production-Suite now I can execute multiple task at once using different claude instances like: 
Batch audio cleaning and editing I'd put off for weeks; Done in an afternoon.
Video prototypes that felt too time-consuming to test; Now I just try them in hours.
Even background tracks for demo videos like this one; Generated in minutes while I work on other tasks.

The more I use it, the more I realize how many of us are stuck doing the same repetitive tasks, burning hours on work that feels automatable but never gets automated.

If you're in audio and video production, podcasting, marketing content, or any multimedia asset creation and you've ever thought "there has to be a better way to do this," I'd love to hear what you're struggling with.

Maybe I've already solved it. Maybe we can figure it out together.

**What production task are you doing right now that feels like it shouldn't take this long?**

#ContentProduction #AIWorkflow #ClaudeCode #VideoProduction #ProductionAutomation #MediaProductionÂ #CreativeAutomation #AudioPostProduction

content:
Seven years ago, I had the privilege to discover this incredible tool that changed my life as a music educator. When I introduced Yousician to my students, the levels of excitement and focus went through the roof! 

In 2014, I founded along with my wife, Guitar Starz Club, in Toronto, Canada. A school of music with a gamified methodology entirely based around this incredible application. 

Since November, I've had the privilege of collaborating with Yousician directly with the mission of helping other music educators transition to this new way of teaching music along with Yousician. 

Now more than ever, we understand the value of digital tools that will help us all (educators and parents) during this period of homeschooling or remote learning.
 
I encourage you all to take a look at this new initiative that will help music educators and their students continue their music lessons during this period of school closures. 

Yousician is now FREE FOR TEACHERS AND THEIR STUDENTS globally through the end of the school year. 
Find out more on yousician.com/teachers, and please share this with your friends and teachers of your children in your network.

content:
I built the easiest way to get professional music from Suno AI.

No complicated prompts. No trial and error. No failed generations.

Just tell it what you want in plain English.

This demo shows what happened when I asked for "an instrumental track inspired by Paint It Black by The Rolling Stones":

What normally happens with Suno AI:
âŒ You mention an artist or song â†’ Copyright violation error
âŒ You try vague descriptions â†’ Generic, disappointing results
âŒ You research musical terminology â†’ Hours wasted
âŒ You write structured prompts with tags â†’ Steep learning curve
âŒ You iterate 5-10 times â†’ Burning through credits

What happens with my Suno V5 orchestrator:
âœ… You describe what you want naturally ("like Paint It Black")
âœ… System automatically analyzes the musical style
âœ… Translates to copyright-safe characteristics
âœ… Formats the perfect prompt with song structure tags
âœ… Generates professional results in 90 seconds

Here's why it works:

Most people don't know music theory. You don't think in terms of "Mixolydian mode" or "syncopated rhythms."

You think: "I want something dark and driving, like Paint It Black."

My system gets that. It uses Perplexity AI to analyze any song or artist you mention, extracts the actual musical characteristics, and writes the technical prompt for you.

The workflow:
1. You describe in natural language
2. Orchestrator detects any artist/song references
3. AI analyzes the musical style (tempo, instrumentation, mood, production)
4. Formats the prompt with proper [Verse] [Chorus] [Bridge] tags
5. Generates with Suno V5
6. Delivers 2 variations in 90 seconds

**Zero copyright violations. Zero technical knowledge needed. Professional results every time.**

And because it shows you a creative brief before generating, you're never surprised by what you get.

This is part of my multimedia-production-suiteâ€”an AI agent system that handles everything from music to video to audio production.

Now production processes can be automated to generate infinite assets and experiment like never before.

With Claude Code agentic capabilities, API integrations, and the proper context engineering, you can have the best production assistance at your fingertips.

What kind of music would you create if it was this easy? Drop a comment.

content:
No Premiere. No After Effects. No Pro Tools.Â 
Just photos, Claude Code, and an agentic orchestration system I designed. 

This video was produced for our client Nalu Retreat - 88 seconds with simulated camera movements, original music, professional voiceover, and frame-accurate editing. 

No traditional production software touched this file.

Most "AI video workflows" still require Premiere for final assembly and Pro Tools for audio post. 

This doesn't. Everything - creative strategy, asset generation, quality verification, editing, final render - happens through agentic orchestration. 

This enables one producer to oversee 3-4 videos simultaneously. 

Traditional workflow: 1 producer = 1 video at a time. 

âœ· The technical architecture:

31 specialized agents across 5 layers. For this video, specific workflows were invoked:

â–¸ Strategic Layer: Analyzes inputs (testimonials, images, brand context), generates creative brief

â–¸ Coordination Layer: Routes tasks across Apify, Perplexity, Kling 2.5, Suno, ElevenLabs, Gemini - handles parallel execution and cost tracking

â–¸ Specialist Orchestrators: Video (intent â†’ provider â†’ generation â†’ QC), Music (analysis â†’ prompt engineering), Voiceover (humanization â†’ emotion tagging)

â–¸ Verification Layer: Gemini 3 scores every asset before approval

â–¸ Assembly Layer: Sound design, video editing, color correction from the brief's storyboard

âœ· Human-in-the-loop precision:

Agents can't calculate exact cut points from BPM. Solution: I built a custom tool where I mark clip start points over audio. Generates JSON with 28 markers across 84 seconds. Agents execute from precise instructions.

Pattern: Agents handle execution. Humans handle creative decisions.

____________

For production managers, creative directors, and post-production leads producing 10+ videos/month:

What content are you not producing right now because of capacity constraints?

DM me if you want to discuss how this system could apply to your production workflow.

#ClaudeCode #AgenticAI #ContentProduction #VideoProduction #SunoAI #ElevenLabs #Kling #Gemini3
